# vImageCVImageFormat_GetFormatCode(_:)

**Function**

Returns the four-character code that encodes the pixel format of a Core Video image format.

## Declaration

```swift
func vImageCVImageFormat_GetFormatCode(_ format: vImageConstCVImageFormat) -> UInt32
```

## Parameters

- **format**: The Core Video image format to query.

## Return Value

The four-character code of the image format, such as [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreVideo/kCVPixelFormatType_420YpCbCr8Planar].

## Discussion

The functions that create Core Video image formats, such as [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat_CreateWithCVPixelBuffer(_:)], return a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat]. The following code shows how you create a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageConstCVImageFormat] representation of a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat] instance to pass to [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat_GetFormatCode(_:)]:

```swift
let formatCode = withUnsafeBytes(of: cvImageFormat) { bytes in
    let format = bytes.assumingMemoryBound(
        to: vImageConstCVImageFormat.self).first!
    
    return vImageCVImageFormat_GetFormatCode(format)
}
```
